access.notes: Landing page links to four product-specific documentation pages via HubSpot CTA tracking redirects. Two products (Juno EHR, RxTracker) have dedicated schema sites on Azure; two (ConnectEHR/CQMsolution, Patient Portal) have HubSpot prose pages.

export_format.description: Juno EHR: CSV files reflecting native SQL Server table structures, plus non-tabular files (images, PDFs, XML, text) exported to the same directory. ConnectEHR: C-CDA 2.1 XML format. CQMsolution: QRDA I XML files. Patient Portal: C-CDA standardized format. RxTracker: CSV files (same pattern as Juno EHR).

table_count_by_product.connectehr: N/A - C-CDA format, prose description only
table_count_by_product.cqmsolution: N/A - QRDA I format, prose description only
table_count_by_product.patient_portal: N/A - C-CDA format, prose description only

documentation.notes: Juno EHR and RxTracker have comprehensive field-level schema docs (1,322 tables total across 1,322 individual HTML pages on ehiexports.junohealth.com). ConnectEHR, CQMsolution, and Patient Portal have prose/screenshot pages describing the export workflow but no field-level data dictionary.

clinical.evidence: Extensive clinical tables in JEHR: ALLERGY (57 fields), CONDITION, DIAGNOSTICREPORT, IMMUNIZATION, MEDICATIONREQUEST, OBSERVATION, PROCEDURE, VITALSIGNS, LAB results, plus 1200+ more tables. RxTracker: PRESCRIPTIONS, MEDICATION_ORDERS, PERSONS_ALLERGIES, PERSONS_PROBLEMS, DIAGNOSES, etc.

secure_messages.evidence: JEHR tables: LKACTIVEMESSAGECONVERSATION, LKACTIVEMESSAGESTATUS, LKMESSAGECATEGORY, LKMESSAGEFOLDER, LKMESSAGEREPLYFORWARD, LKMESSAGETYPE, LKRECEIVEMESSAGESTATUS, LKSENDMESSAGESTATUS, LKSENDMESSAGETEXTTYPE, LKSMSMESSAGETYPE, DIAGNOSTICREPORTCLINICALCOMMUNICATION, NURSEBRAINCLINICALCOMMUNICATION. RxTracker: No message tables found.

billing_financial.evidence: JEHR tables: ACCOUNT, ACCOUNTBILLINGSTATUSHISTORY, BILLINGITEM, BILLINGITEMEXCEPTION, CHARGEITEMDEFINITION (with 7 related tables), ENCOUNTERBILLING, ENCOUNTERESTIMATETRANSACTION, ENCOUNTERINSURANCETRANSACTION, FINANCIALGROUP, RCM1500CLAIM, RCM1500CLAIMSERVICE, RCMUB04CLAIM, RCMUB04CLAIMSERVICE, ORDERCLAIMRESPONSE, TRANSACTIONCODE, MEDICATIONDISPENSETRANSACTION, plus lookup tables for billing status, submission format, billing type, payment method, claim status, transaction type, etc.

insurance_coverage.evidence: JEHR tables: COVERAGE, COVERAGEINSURANCEPLAN, COVERAGERESPONSIBLEPERSON, COVERAGERESPONSIBLEPERSONEMPLOYER, ACCOUNTCOVERAGE, ENCOUNTERCOVERAGE, ENCOUNTERINSURANCE, ENCOUNTERINSURANCEESTIMATE, ENCOUNTERINSURANCETRANSACTION, ENCOUNTERVAELIGIBILITY, plus extensive LKINSURANCE* lookup tables (LKINSURANCECOMPANY, LKINSURANCEPLAN, LKINSURANCEPLANORGANIZATION, etc.) and LKCOVERAGE* tables. RxTracker: ENCOUNTER_PAYERS.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: JEHR tables: SCHEDULE, SCHEDULECALLLOG, SCHEDULECOMMENT, SCHEDULEHISTORY, SCHEDULEPRACTITIONER, SCHEDULERESOURCE, SCHEDULESESSION, SCHEDULESESSIONACTIVE, SCHEDULESESSIONCOMMENT, SCHEDULESESSIONCONFLICT, SCHEDULESESSIONDETAIL, SCHEDULESESSIONDETAILDIAGNOSIS, SCHEDULESESSIONDETAILNOTE, SCHEDULESESSIONPRACTITIONER, SCHEDULESESSIONRESOURCE, PATIENTSCHEDULEPREFERENCE, plus 40+ LKSCHEDULE* lookup tables.

documents_images.evidence: JEHR tables: DOCUMENTREFERENCE, DOCUMENTREFERENCECODE, DOCUMENTREFERENCEFILESTORAGE, DOCUMENTREFERENCERELATESTO, DOCUMENTREFERENCESECURITYLABEL, MEDIA, MEDIACODE, MEDIAIDENTIFIER, MEDIANOTE, MEDIAPARTOF, MEDIAREASONCODE, MEDIAREASONCODECODING, MEDIATYPE, plus AMENDMENTREQUESTDOCUMENTREFERENCE, RELEASEOFINFORMATIONDOCUMENTREFERENCE. Landing page confirms non-tabular files (images, PDFs, XML, text documents) are also exported alongside CSVs. RxTracker: DOCUMENTS, DOCUMENT_TYPES, RECONCILIATIONS_DOCUMENTS.

audit_trails.evidence: JEHR tables: PROVENANCE, PROVENANCEAGENT (with LKPROVENANCEPARTICIPANTTYPE), plus history tables: ACCOUNTBILLINGSTATUSHISTORY, ENCOUNTERADTHISTORY, ENCOUNTERSTATUSHISTORY, GOALHISTORY, IMPLANTABLEDEVICEHISTORY, INTERVENTIONHISTORY, INTERVENTIONTRACKING, MEDICATIONREQUESTEVENTHISTORY, PATIENTDEMOGRAPHICSHISTORY, PENDINGORDERTRANSHISTORY, SCHEDULEHISTORY, TASKTRACKING, ENCOUNTERASSESSMENTTRACKING, AU_PHARMACY_PATIENT_IV_LABEL_TRACKING. RxTracker: No dedicated audit tables.

downloaded_files.notes: Index page listing 1,256 tables. Each table links to an individual HTML page at ./TABLE_NAME.html on the same host.
Index page listing 66 tables. Each table links to an individual HTML page at ./TABLE_NAME.html on the same host.

issues: ConnectEHR and CQMsolution use limited ePHI USCDIv1 definition for (b)(10) certification rather than full EHI — this means their exports may only cover USCDI v1 data elements, not all EHI
Patient Portal similarly certified under USCDIv1 definition rather than full EHI
No downloadable ZIP/archive of all 1,322 table documentation pages; each is a separate HTML file on Azure Blob Storage
ConnectEHR, CQMsolution, and Patient Portal lack field-level data dictionaries — only prose descriptions and screenshots of the export workflow
Export format varies by product: CSV (Juno EHR/RxTracker), C-CDA XML (ConnectEHR/Patient Portal), QRDA I XML (CQMsolution)
No sample export files or developer guide provided
summary: Juno Health provides comprehensive EHI export documentation across five products. The standout is Juno EHR with 1,256 database tables documented at field level (column names, SQL data types, descriptions, foreign keys) on a dedicated Azure-hosted schema site. RxTracker adds 66 more tables in the same format. Both export as CSV files reflecting native SQL Server structures, with non-tabular files (images, PDFs, XML) exported alongside. ConnectEHR and Patient Portal export in C-CDA 2.1 XML format, while CQMsolution exports QRDA I XML — these three products have only prose/screenshot documentation without field-level data dictionaries. The Juno EHR schema covers clinical, billing (including RCM claims), insurance, scheduling, documents, messaging, and audit/provenance data domains extensively.
